issue.title: Register Db2 resource bundle classes for reflection

labels.name: area/jdbc
labels.description: Issues related to the JDBC extensions

issue.body:
Draft as it doesn't work but I thought some other people might want to play with it.

Fixes #46403

body:
I tried to fix it here: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46491 but it doesn't work.

The string in question is in `com.ibm.db2.jcc.resources.Resources` which I now register for reflection but it didn't help.

The resource bundle is loaded with `ResourceBundle.getBundle("com.ibm.db2.jcc.resources.Resources");`

@zakkak maybe you would have an idea?

> I tried to fix it here: [#46491](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46491) but it doesn't work.

Hi @gsmet , this doesn't work because you are registering the class for reflection and not as a resource bundle. I pushed [a fixup](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/46491/commits/0525f0fbfd26c11cbb9abfe93ad8b61571cfe26b) to your PR, please have a look.
The PR is now ready thanks to @zakkak ! Now we all know that ResourceBundle classes are handled very specifically...

I can review the PR/validate the fix, but not before ~7 p.m. cet. Otherwise, if you've already validated the fix, please just go ahead and merge.

@gsmet When the PR is merged, can we get a backport to `3.15` (and possibly `3.8`)?
We might consider 3.15 but I don't think we will push it to 3.8.
